comment:
This class is no joke, so show up and pay attention! This guy is by far the best one to teach it, so 
I've heard. He doesn't require a textbook because he gives summary notes which are fine (I bought the recommended book and it didn't help). His lectures are fine and the PPT's definitely help you learn. He's an Excel wizard which is great!
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor is great! However, this is by far the hardest class I have ever taken. This is a class that you need to be in everyday and participating! You get an 8.5x11 cheat sheet on each test. I would start creating it from day one. Also, there are proctored quizzes and assignments however the test are still graded heavy!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The content of this class is very challenging but he is a good professor and was always willing to answer questions and take time to help with anything. The quizzes are pretty easy but the tests were difficult because of the amount of content they covered. Would recommend him but just be prepared because it is a really hard class

You have to go to class. This class is probably the hardest I've ever taken as an accounting major and it really requires staying on top of it and studying outside of class. That being said, Macdonald is very skilled at teaching the information and it really felt like he wanted everyone to pass.

If you get the chance to take a class with Prof. MacDonald, definitely do so! I took this as an online summer class, so the tests and quizzes were structured differently. He gives an optional quiz and final to replace lowest grade in each category. Excel assignments are basically mirroring his videos. Plenty of material for review and studying.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Took me five times to pass this, somebody give this man a raise!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Don't listen to the bad reviews. His lectures are straightforward and mirror what's on quizzes and exams. Cheat sheet is allowed on exams as well, making them much easier. 3 Excel assignments where you copy what he does in Excel videos. Lowest quiz and test can replaced. If you don't do well in this class, you're either lazy or just slow.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Do not take online. By far the hardest class I have taken at KSU and the lectures did not help me learn the material at all. 3 tests worth 75% of your grade. 5 quizzes worth 15%. 3 assignments worth 10%. No room for error.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class was very difficult. His lectures do not help with the tests, so you're left to reverse-engineer how everything is calculated, as well as self-teach to not fail the short-answer & true/false. His test answers are particularly heartless. He words the questions and makes the answers much more difficult than it actually is. I wouldnt take.

HE MAKES IT HARDER THAN IT ACTUALLY IS. The only reason I passed was bc I got in a study group with a few people. We had to self-teach everything, the lectures were pretty useless. He teaches way too quickly and the people across the big room from him can't hear because he doesn't use the mic. Just get in a study group and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He teaches rather quickly and occasionally dismisses class early. Allows cheat sheets on exams. Replies to email quickly and is willing to help you clarify concepts in office hours. Assignments took forever, but only counted for 10% of the final grade.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Caring--Test heavy

comment: Great professor who does an amazing job explaining the tough concepts in a way that is easy to understand. There are 2 tests and a final, which cover most of the grade, but you can have a cheat sheet. The quizzes are lockdown and are difficult, but are not worth that much of your grade.

comment: Avoid this professor for this class

comment: Fast lecturer! Be prepared to find outside sources to learn on your own. Many people dropped this class. No outline on what would be covered each week. Pop up assignments. Don't miss class. Too little of testing, assignments, and quizzes. Final worth 40% of your grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: The 3 exams cover 75% of your grade. You need to do well on them to pass. The PowerPoints & material he posts is good enough to learn everything if you have some understanding of excel & statistics. Otherwise he explains everything well in class. The material takes some mental effort, but doing well is very achievable. Just ask questions in class.

comment: Quizzes kicked my butt. They are on lockdown and only have 6 questions so getting one wrong is an 83, two wrong is a 66. Just study his PowerPoints like crazy and use YouTube to supplement and you should be fine. Never attended class because of scheduling conflicts with my job/family and ended the class with a low A.

comment: Teaches extremely fast. He confuses everyone and makes the content difficult to learn. I dreaded this class. He gave no information on tests and quizzes when the whole class did bad. So many people dropped this class at midterms.

comment: You will have to spend a good amount of time on the material and it isn't the easiest, but definitely doable. Allowed cheat sheet on the tests, which helped.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Listen, this class is not a joke. You have to put two hours in for every hour lecture he teaches. You need to be at every single class or you will never catch up. His office hours saved me. Econ 3300 is one of the toughest courses at KSU, but he makes it so its possible to pass.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Im not sure how this man has such a high rating. He teaches extremely fast and leaves everyone confused. 86% of the class failed the last quiz and he acted like nothing was wrong with that. Most of us are just praying for a C at this point. Allows cheat sheets but they dont help. So good luck if you choose him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: The man is an Excel wizard. If you ask nicely, he just might drop some of those bombs on you. Econ 3300 is NOT easy. Prof. Macdonald at least makes the class enjoyable - but pay attention and DO THE WORK.

comment: Take MacDonald for ECON 3300! I originally has this class with another professor, and I had to drop it. comment: Hard class, good professor for it though. comment: Not a hard teacher, as long as you are good at teaching yourself. Very boring lectures that teach you at a very high level. comment: probably one of the best professors I have ever had. Incredible teaching... amazing lectures. I wish every professor was as good as he is.

comment: If you're a business major at Ksu, you have to take Econ 3300 with someone, Macdonald is definitely a solid choice, particularly if you're smart but not great with Excel. comment: The class is very easy in regards to the actual material and he's a very good lecturer. comment: Class is definitely not easy but very interesting. Dr. MacDonald is super picky when grading, but also gives a ton of partial credit. Overall, I really enjoyed his class. This has a reputation as being a very difficult class, and I highly recommend anyone who can take him does.

comment: Very knowledgeable. Good teacher. Easy tests. Gives lectures with no notes. Explains everything really well. Clear class structure and grading. Ample time to finish the 3-4 assignments throughout the semester. Take him and you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He's a great professor. It's a difficult class just based on content, but he makes the best of it and tries to keep it fun. The class structure is pretty basic and easy to maneuver, with 3 tests, 4 quizzes and 3 assignments. He's approachable and just a genuinely nice guy. He's very good at what he does. Lectures mostly from notes (on D2l) & excel
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This course is hard, no way around that. You will not find a better professor for it though. He is good at explaining the concepts and will answer any questions you have.  The class time was inconvenient (9:30PM) but I do not regret taking him in order to pass the class.  I had to drop 3300 before and he was the key to my success this time around.

His tests are HARD. I have a 4.0 and now I am getting a C in this class. DO NOT TAKE AT 8AM.  I had 5 classes this semester, and work. This is not the class to take if you lead a busy lifestyle. Choose another professor for that. This class can easily take up 20+ hours per week of studying to make an A, and I didn't have that luxury. Nice person.

This is a hard class. Point blank. He really tries hard to make the class more interesting. His humor makes the 8 AM easier, and his energy emulates through the room. He genuinely wants his students to do well, and really encourages asking for help in class and out. He is a stand up man, and one of my favorite professors in the business school.

Teacher is d harderst teacher ive ever taken. Class is very hard n he goes into so much detail is so confusing. 3 tests, 3 quizzes n 3 hard assignts.  His tests r in 3 sections mult choice, short answers, truefalse and show ur work math problems!! I have a 3.7 GPA n i was very scared of his tests all 3 times, very hard. His notes donot help. B+

He provides the best notes and only test you on those notes. Didn't need the book and the book made the material more confusing. Best Econ teacher I ever had. Took the class in the summer (Don't recommend. 2 test, 4 quizzes (not too easy),4 assignments (easy) for Excel, and Optional final to replace lowest test score. Don't skip class.

Prof MacDonald is VERY enthusiastic about teaching this subject.  He takes the time every class to make sure that everyone understands how to work the problems.  He is very easy to understand.  The class requires a lot of math and if you're relatively good with algebra you won't need the book. I would definitely recommend taking his class!!
Notes given during class are in depth and kind of intimidating, but use the study guides to prepare for tests and it's easy. He has a great personality and makes class enjoyable too.

Great teacher. The information and class in general sucks, but he will go over problems as much as you need help. He's nice and even though attendance is not mandatory, if you miss a class, you miss a lot of information.
He is a wonderful prof. He is very easy going and nice and explains a very difficult subject in terms you can understand. His tests are tough but if you come to class, study and you'll do just fine.

Goes through lessons pretty quickly in class but does post notes on Vista for you to review if you missed class or couldnt keep up with lectures in class. Definitely go to class the days he reviews before tests. SO helpful & the study guides are identical to the tests. No surprises on tests.

tough class, he moves fast through stuff. I learned most of this class from the notes that he posts online. barely got a C. Good teacher, but read his notes before going to class. it'll make it easier to understand what the heck the teacher is saying.

The over all subject is difficult in itself but the professor provides notes on vista and in class to help with the material. His lectures at times can be too much to grasp at once but he posts previous exams online before each test so you can have an idea of whats going to be on the test. Many times a lot of the hard material is left off. curves.

loved this professor! attend class and take good notes and you will get an A! sit toward the front because his writing on the board isn't always easy to read. teaches very clearly. allows formula sheets for exams. at-home assignments are very helpful in applying the material learned in class. i signed up for this professor again next semester!

I took this class this past summer with another professor who teaching was confusing and when you did have a question only referred you to her confusing video.  Needless to say, I failed the class.  Prof MacDonald taught this class with so much more clarity.  Helps takes  the time so you can understand statistics.Class attendance helpsin this class
Great teacher. Very helpful if need be. I found the class fairly easy. Homework a big help. Definitely would recommend taking him.

This was my second time taking Business Statistics and Mr. MacDonald made the subject much easier. He does a lot to help his students.He is a fantastic teacher and I highly recommend him for this very difficult course.

Prof. MacDonald is a really nice guy. He's always willing to help and answer questions. Personally though, I had difficulty with his teaching style, which is very unstructured and disconnected with the class. My biggest tip: Be sure and start your computer at the beginning of class, he wont give you any warning before he demonstrates Excel problems
Great instructor for a course that can be difficult. Prof MacDonald was positive, helpful, and patient with questions.

Professor MacDonald is one of the better professors I've had in a while.  He's very helpful and courteous to his students, which is great because ECON3300 is fairly complicated. His grading is fair and includes 3 tests and 1 optional final. I would highly recommend him.

This class is really hard, be prepared to do A LOT of studying outside of class. The teacher is okay, quite boring I think, but he's not a bad teacher at all. I withdrew after the first test, the class was much more difficult than I expected... don't sign up unless you're ready to commit 110%.

This class was extremely hard. But this teacher did a job well done. He explained things really well. Tests were average, not too easy but not too hard. He curves his grades which was extremely helpful.
